department_name: Department of Geography, Geo Informatics and Climatic Sciences

courses.name: Bachelor of Science in Geography
courses.description: This program provides comprehensive knowledge of physical and human geography, spatial analysis, and geographical information systems.

course_units.title: Introduction to Geography
course_units.description: Fundamental concepts and principles of geography.

course_units.title: Physical Geography
course_units.description: Study of landforms, climate, soils, vegetation, and water bodies.

course_units.title: Map Reading and Interpretation
course_units.description: Basic cartographic concepts and map interpretation skills.

course_units.title: Human Geography
course_units.description: Study of population, settlements, and human activities on Earth.

course_units.title: Introduction to GIS
course_units.description: Basic concepts and applications of geographic information systems.

course_units.title: Field Methods in Geography
course_units.description: Techniques for collecting geographical data in the field.

course_units.title: Geomorphology
course_units.description: Study of landforms and the processes that shape them.

course_units.title: Spatial Analysis
course_units.description: Methods and techniques for analyzing spatial data.

course_units.title: Remote Sensing
course_units.description: Principles and applications of remote sensing technology.

course_units.title: Climatology
course_units.description: Study of climate systems and climate patterns.

course_units.title: Urban Geography
course_units.description: Spatial analysis of urban areas and urban processes.

course_units.title: Advanced GIS
course_units.description: Advanced techniques and applications in GIS.

course_units.title: Environmental Geography
course_units.description: Geographical aspects of environmental issues and management.

course_units.title: Geography of Development
course_units.description: Spatial aspects of development processes and patterns.

course_units.title: Research Methods in Geography
course_units.description: Research methodologies for geographical studies.

course_units.title: Geography Capstone Project
course_units.description: Independent research project in geography.

course_units.title: Geospatial Data Management
course_units.description: Management and analysis of geospatial data.

course_units.title: Applied Geography
course_units.description: Application of geographical concepts and methods to real-world problems.

courses.name: Bachelor of Science in Climate Science
courses.description: This program focuses on understanding climate systems, climate change, and its impacts on natural and human systems.

course_units.title: Introduction to Climate Science
course_units.description: Fundamental concepts and principles of climate science.

course_units.title: Earth System Science
course_units.description: Study of interactions between Earth's atmosphere, hydrosphere, biosphere, and geosphere.

course_units.title: Meteorological Measurements
course_units.description: Techniques for measuring meteorological parameters.

course_units.title: Atmospheric Physics
course_units.description: Physical principles of atmospheric processes.

course_units.title: Climate Data Analysis
course_units.description: Statistical methods for analyzing climate data.

course_units.title: Introduction to Climate Modeling
course_units.description: Basic concepts of climate models and simulations.

course_units.title: Global Climate Systems
course_units.description: Study of global climate systems and their interactions.

course_units.title: Climate Change Science
course_units.description: Scientific basis of climate change and its evidence.

course_units.title: Remote Sensing for Climate Studies
course_units.description: Application of remote sensing in climate research.

course_units.title: Regional Climatology
course_units.description: Study of climate patterns and processes at regional scales.

course_units.title: Climate and Society
course_units.description: Interactions between climate and human societies.

course_units.title: GIS for Climate Studies
course_units.description: Application of geographic information systems in climate research.

course_units.title: Climate Impacts and Vulnerability
course_units.description: Assessment of climate change impacts and vulnerability.

course_units.title: Climate Adaptation and Mitigation
course_units.description: Strategies for adapting to and mitigating climate change.

course_units.title: Research Methods in Climate Science
course_units.description: Research methodologies for climate studies.

course_units.title: Climate Science Capstone Project
course_units.description: Independent research project in climate science.

course_units.title: Climate Policy and Governance
course_units.description: Policies and governance systems for addressing climate change.

course_units.title: Climate Services
course_units.description: Provision of climate information for decision-making.
